description: Change of use from a coffee shop (class A1) to a restaurant (class A3).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and specifications, unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 3 - Details of any external ventilation equipment, including ducting, noise and vibration mitigation, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before installation.
In the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1.
Condition : 4 - The premises shall  not be open to customers other than between the hours of 11:00 to 22:30 (Monday to Friday) and 09:30 to 22:00 (Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holidays) and at no other times.
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. 
Condition : 5 - Details of noise insulation measures to provide effective resistance to the transmission of airborne and impact sound between Class A3 (restaurant) and resdinetial properties to both adjacent sides and above the commercial premises shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be completed prior to the commencement of the use of the premises as a restaurant (Class A3). 
To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. 
Condition : 6 - The use of the front and rear outdoor seating areas shall not be used for purposes relating to the restaurant (Class A3) use hereby approved between 18:00 to 11:00 hours Monday to Friday and from 18:00 to 09:30 hours Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holidays. 
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval.
Condition : 7 - Details of arrangements for the storage of refuse shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before the development/use begins.  The works shall be carried out before the permitted use starts.
In the interests of amenity and hygiene, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of the approved use to ensure adequate provision for waste is made in the interests of the amenity of future occupiers of the development and the area in compliance with the Council policy cited above.
Condition : 8 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
